intro: Virgulus falcatus var. commutatus, commonly known as the narrow-leafed virgulus, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus plants. The plant is characterized by its elongated, narrow leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
